title: How to Set Up Storm Response Outreach
description: Be first to contact customers after severe weather with automated storm alerts and outreach.
requirements: A list of past customers in your service area
Weather alert setup on your phone
Pre-written outreach templates ready to go

steps.title: Set up weather alerts
substeps: Enable government severe weather alerts on your phone
Download a weather app with push notifications (Weather.com, WeatherBug)
Set alerts for: Hail, high winds, flooding (depending on your trade)
Consider paid apps like Storm Radar for more detailed alerts
steps.tip: Focus on weather events that damage what you fix: hail for roofers, floods for plumbers, wind for tree services.

steps.title: Create your storm outreach templates
steps.description: Have messages ready to send immediately.
substeps: Go to ChatGPT and create templates for different storm types
Prompt: 'Write a text message to past customers after a hailstorm offering free roof inspections. Keep it helpful, not salesy.'
Create versions for: Hail, wind damage, flooding, ice storms
Save these where you can copy-paste quickly

steps.title: Prepare your customer contact list
substeps: Export customer phone numbers and emails
Segment by service area if you cover multiple towns
Have this list ready to use at a moment's notice
Consider using a mass texting service like SimpleTexting

steps.title: Create a rapid response checklist
substeps: Storm happens → Check damage reports in your area
Within 1 hour → Send text blast to affected area customers
Same day → Post on social media (local groups, Nextdoor)
Next morning → Follow up with email and calls
steps.tip: Speed matters. First responders get the jobs. Wait 24 hours and you're competing with everyone.

steps.title: Offer free inspections
steps.description: Remove friction from the first contact.
substeps: Free inspection builds trust and gets you in the door
Document damage thoroughly for insurance claims
Help customers navigate insurance if applicable
Not everyone has damage — that's fine, it's goodwill

steps.title: Track the results
substeps: Count: Messages sent, responses, inspections booked, jobs closed
Note what messaging worked best
Update your templates based on feedback
Storm season can be your most profitable time if you're ready

successMessage: You're now ready for storm response! Being first to reach customers means first to get the work.
proTips: Join local Facebook groups — people post about damage there first
Partner with insurance agents who can refer customers your way
Have extra capacity available (subcontractors, crew) for storm season
